articles.title: Message of Sympathy to Kim Jong Il from Hu Jintao
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Kim Jong Il from Hu Jintao
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, on July 29 received a message of sympathy from Hu Jintao, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and president of the People's Republic of China.
					 The message says:
					
					 I was informed of severe flood that hit some areas of your country recently, claiming casualties and property losses.
					
					 On behalf of the Chinese government and people, I express deep sympathy and sincere consolation to you and, through you, to the government and people of the DPRK.
					
					 I express belief that your people will eradicate the aftermath of the severe flood damage and lead a stable life without fail under the powerful leadership of you, the WPK and the DPRK government.

articles.title: China Decides to Offer Emergency Relief Materials to DPRK
articles.content:
China Decides to Offer Emergency Relief Materials to DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- The Chinese government and the Red Cross Society of China decided to offer emergency relief materials to the DPRK as regards flood damage.
					 Their providing emergency relief materials will greatly encourage the Korean people in their drive for rehabilitation in the flood-stricken areas.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Unpopular Education Policy Denounced
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Unpopular Education Policy Denounced
						
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Youth and Student Sub-Committee of the North Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration issued the following statement Sunday:
					 The actions of youth and students and other people to have the university registration fee issue solved and the registration fee halved are sweeping across south Korea.
					
					 The government promised to halve the university registration fee in a bid to help families bring down their burdens of education expenses. This was traitor Lee Myung Bak's commitment during his "presidential campaign."
					
					 No sooner had he come to power than he threw away this commitment like a pair of old shoes, depriving youth and students of the opportunity of learning. South Korea is thus ill-famed for appalling registration fee. 
					
					 Enraged by this, the youth and students of south Korea launched the actions to have the registration fee halved. This was joined by lots of civic and social organizations including the Citizens' Solidarity for Democratic Society, the Teachers' Union and the Society of Parents of Students for Genuine Education. Even opposition parties responded to it.
					
					 The Sub-Committee, together with the youth and students in the DPRK, extends full solidarity and warm support to the south Korean youth and students and all other people who turned out against the Lee group's unpopular education policy.
					
					 The south Korean youth and students are suffering from misfortune and pain more than others under the rule of traitor Lee and the "Grand National Party".
					
					  A great number of students are dropping from the school unable to afford the tuition fee rising on annual basis. They are toiling and moiling at working places to earn money to pay for education.
					
					 Not a few young people have taken their own lives calling for a society without registration fee and not a few parents committed suicides in face of soaring registration fee, leaving a note asking for their children's forgiveness.
					
					 It is the biggest crime to deprive the youth of their precious and urgent right to learn and to drive them to despair and death, far from injecting hope and vitality into them.
					
					 The tragic happenings in south Korea caused by the unaffordable registration fee eloquently prove that south Korea under the rule of Lee and GNP is a land of destitution and a tundra of human rights without future.
					
					 It is not possible to meet the desire of the people to have the registration fee halved nor is it possible to expect hopeful tomorrow and happiness as long as the Lee Myung Bak group is allowed to go scot-free, deceiving and mocking at the people to remain in power.
					
					 The protest demonstrations, sit-ins, candlelight rallies and one- million signature campaign now under way in different parts of south Korea are pushing the Lee group into a serious political crisis.
					
					 Righteous and brave south Korean youth and students, aware of their responsibility and role as vanguard forces, should fight it out in solidarity with the people from all walks of life to throw Lee Myung Bak and the GNP into the abyss of ruin and bring about a new society without registration fee, a society where everyone leads a genuine life, given ample opportunity of learning.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Kang Pan Sok
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Kang Pan Sok
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were laid before the statue of Kang Pan Sok, an indomitable revolutionary fighter and an outstanding leader of the Korean women's movement, at the Chilgol Revolutionary Site and her grave in Mangyongdae on Sunday, the 79th anniversary of her demise.
					 Seen there were wreaths from Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremonies were senior party, state and army officials and officials of party and power bodies, working people's organizations and ministries, servicepersons and working people in the city of Pyongyang.
					
					 Placed before the statue and grave were wreaths in the name of the WPK Central Committee, the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly and the DPRK Cabinet.
					
					 Also laid were wreaths from working people's organizations, ministries, military universities, education and media organs, revolutionary schools and party and power organs, farms and others in the city.
					
					 The participants paid a silent tribute to Kang Pan Sok, recalling her brilliant revolutionary life.

articles.title: Kang Pan Sok, Great Revolutionary
articles.content:
Kang Pan Sok, Great Revolutionary
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- July 31 marks the 79th death anniversary of Kang Pan Sok, mother of President Kim Il Sung and indomitable revolutionary. 
					 In his reminiscences "With the Century" the President wrote:
					
					 "Her whole life served as a textbook for me in implanting in me a true view on life and on the revolution."
					
					 The love she showed him was not simply motherly love. It was true revolutionary affection with which she regarded him as the son of the nation rather than her own son and awakened him to the need to give priority to loyalty to the country over filial piety towards his parents. 
					
					 She was a woman with such a kind heart as to accord a warm welcome to a stranger of his age of thirteen if she knew that he needed shelter after a journey. 
					
					 But she ordered his son to leave for Linjiang immediately, even though he traveled hundreds of miles on foot in the coldest season and arrived in Badaogou. Though she had not seen him for two years, she did not allowed him to stay with her even for a night. 
					
					 As he set out on a journey again as soon as he had met his mother, he learned that the road of revolution is rough and it was the real love of a mother. 
					
					 This story is well known in the country. 
					
					 One day she, seeing his son who hesitated to leave her because of her sickness, scolded him severely: "How can a man who has turned out with a determination to win back his country cope with the great cause when he has such a weak heart and so many worries about his home?"
					
					 The love Kang Ban Sok showed his son and the filial piety he devoted to his mother are based on patriotism.
					
					 Kang Pan Sok was also a great teacher who taught his son the truth that a revolutionary should always concentrate on attaining his goal, not prompted by pity.

articles.title: Korean Women Benefit from Law on Sex Equality
articles.content:
Korean Women Benefit from Law on Sex Equality
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung promulgated "Law on Sex Equality in North Korea" on July 30, Juche 35 (1946) to legally provide the women with equal rights to the men in the political, economic and cultural fields.
					 Since the promulgation of the law, the Korean women have enjoyed a worthwhile life, taking part in the state affairs.
					
					Under the care of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, they are rolling one of the two wheels of the Songun-based revolution.
					
					 In his famous works like "Women Are a Dynamic Force Pushing Ahead with the Revolution and Construction", he called for respecting women in society and training many women officials.
					
					 He visited the Pyongyang Textile Mill on July 30, 2009 and congratulated its women employees on the 63rd anniversary of the promulgation of the law on sex equality.
					
					 In the DPRK, the number of women deputies to people's assemblies at all levels is steadily increasing.
					
					 The Korean women are playing a big role in the effort for the building of a thriving nation.

articles.title: Action for Resignation of Anti-Reunification Element Declared in S. Korea
articles.content:
Action for Resignation of Anti-Reunification Element Declared in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- Civic and public organizations of south Korea held a press conference outside the general building of the "government" in Seoul on July 27 to declare the start of people's action for getting Hyon In Thaek, puppet minister of Unification, resigned.
					 They included the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification, the Confederation of Trade Unions and the Association for Supporting Prisoners of Conscience of the Family Movement for Realizing Democracy.
					
					 Speeches were made at the conference before a press release was read out.
					
					 The release deplored that the north-south relations are put in an irreversible state due to the Lee Myung Bak "government's" repeated anti-reunification policy for confrontation.
					
					 This is attributable to such guys as Hyon In Thaek who invented the confrontation policy like the watchword "no nukes, opening and 3000 dollars" and is engaged on the anti-DPRK smear campaign, grabbing power, it said, adding:
					
					 It is natural that Hyon, who once insisted on the abolition of the Ministry of Unification, cannot properly deal with the work related to reunification.
					
					 It is impossible to expect improvement of relations or dialogue with the north as long as such guy is allowed to stay in power, the release said, urging the "government" to remove Hyon from his office at once and show its willingness to improve the inter-Korean relations as the promise to implement the joint declarations.
					
					 All the forces supporting the joint declarations will get united as one to conduct an all-people campaign for impeaching and getting Hyon resigned, oust all the confrontation maniacs against reunification who are bringing the crisis of a new war and certainly judge the treacherous crimes of the Lee Myung Bak "government", it said.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group's Confrontation Racket Slammed
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group's Confrontation Racket Slammed
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification in a statement on July 26 denounced the Lee Myung Bak group for its confrontation racket against national reunification.
					 On July 24 and 25 the Intelligence Service searched the house and office of the chief editor of magazine Minjok 21 on the suspicion that he perpetrated an espionage act on someone's "instructions", the statement noted.
					
					 Such repression of this legitimate magazine acting for the implementation of the June 15 joint declaration is a move to put down the reunification movement and gag the progressive media, it charged.
					
					 The IS and other ultra-right conservative forces, the statement said,  are now orchestrating such unprecedented burlesques for suppression as the "case of the Iljin Association" one after another while talking about "instructions of the north", "espionage act" and the like.
					
					 The flunkeyist and traitorous forces seeking war and confrontation while hindering peace and reunification will surely face a stern punishment by the nation, the statement warned, urging the Lee Myung Bak "government" and the IS to stop at once the frantic suppression.

articles.title: Building of Jeju Naval Base Protested in S. Korea
articles.content:
Building of Jeju Naval Base Protested in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Measure Council for Checking the Construction of Jeju Naval Base held a press conference on July 25 to condemn the puppet group's move to build a military base.
					 A press release was read out at the conference.
					
					 The release noted that Kangjong villagers have turned out in a death-defying resistance to protect their cradle of life from the military authorities' attempt to build a naval base.
					
					 The "government" and the military authorities, however, are setting in motion the police under the plea of "security" to arrest and detain at random protesting inhabitants and members of different organizations, it charged.
					
					 Any act of forcing sacrifice on Jeju islanders and threatening peace and environment can never be allowed, it said.
					
					 Strongly denouncing the "government" and the military authorities for pushing forward the project by means of violence, the release expressed the resolution to vigorously struggle for peace of the Kangjong village and the life of the people.

articles.title: War Victory Day of DPRK Marked Abroad
articles.content:
War Victory Day of DPRK Marked Abroad
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- A seminar was held in Democratic Congo and a lecture and film shows in Russia on July 22 and 23 to mark the 58th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					On display at the venue of the seminar were works of President Kim Il Sung and Genearal Secretary Kim Jong Il and books and photos introducing Songun Korea.
					
					 The deputy general secretary of the C.C., Communist Party of Democratic Congo and other speakers said that the victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War would have been unthinkable without the extraordinary military strategies of the President.
					
					 They stressed that he was not only the gifted thinker-theoretician but also extraordinary strategist and invincible and iron-willed commander.
					
					 Under the Songun politics of Kim Jong Il the Korean people are reliably defending the sovereignty of the country and socialism despite the constant military threat of the imperialists, they noted.
					
					 If the U.S. imperialists and their followers ignite another war in Korea, they would face a bitterer defeat than what they suffered in the past war, they said.
					
					 Appreciated at the shows were Korean films.

articles.title: Branches of Bangladesh Institute of Juche Idea Formed
articles.content:
Branches of Bangladesh Institute of Juche Idea Formed
   Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- The Chittagong Branch of the Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea was formed on July 23.
					 Present at its inaugural ceremony were Chairman M. Gamrul Huda, Secretary General Sheikh Rafiqul Islam Bablu, the adviser and other personages of the Institute and Juche idea followers.
					
					 The adviser was elected chairman of the branch.
					
					 The secretary general of the Institute, in his speech at the ceremony, declared that they would further expand the Institute and intensify the study and dissemination of the Juche idea with the forthcoming world conference of Juche idea for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung as an occasion.
					
					 Two other branches of the Institute were inaugurated on July 21 and 22.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Peruvian Internet
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Peruvian Internet
Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- The Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship posted the full text of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification" on its Internet homepage on July 20.
					 The work, published on August 4, 1997, clarifies the undying feats of President Kim Il Sung for national reunification and formulates the three principles of national reunification, the 10-point programme for the great unity of the whole nation and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo as the three charters for national reunification. It also indicates the tasks and ways for achieving national reunification on the basis of them.

articles.title: Chinese Defence Ministry Accuses US of Wrong Act
articles.content:
Chinese Defence Ministry Accuses US of Wrong Act
 Beijing, July 30 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Chinese Ministry of Defence in a regular news briefing on July 27 accused the U.S. of its wrong act.
					 In June a Chinese fighters deterred a U.S. reconnaissance plane from conducting close espionage in the Straits of Taiwan. This espionage on China by the U.S. military hamstrung the bilateral relations, the spokesman said.
					
					 The U.S. House of Representatives' recent adoption of a resolution on selling arms to Taiwan gravely hurt the core interests of China, and the Chinese is resolutely opposed to it, he noted.
					
					 China urges the U.S. to abide by the principles of the three joint communiques adopted between the two countries, he added.

articles.title: Inter-continental Ballistic Missile Launched in Russia
articles.content:
Inter-continental Ballistic Missile Launched in Russia
 Moscow, July 30 (KCNA) -- Strategic nuclear missile submarine Yekaterinburg of the Arctic Sea Fleet of Russia successfully launched inter-continental ballistic missile Sineva in the waters of the Barents Sea on July 27, Russia's Defence Ministry reported.
					 The missile, launched in the diving according to the plan to examine the reliability of marine strategic nuclear forces, hit target at the Kura firing range in Kamchatka at the fixed time.

articles.title: Iran's FM Calls for Release of Iranians Jailed in US
articles.content:
Iran's FM Calls for Release of Iranians Jailed in US
						
 Tehran, July 30 (KCNA) -- Iran's Foreign Minister Ali-Akbar Salehi on Wednesday called for release of Iranians jailed in the U.S.
					 He said the process of trapping and kidnapping innocent Iranians is an example of the U.S. administration's confrontation with the Iranian nation.
					
					 The Iranian government will continue to make efforts until the Iranians are released, he stressed.

articles.title: Iran Says Israel behind Assassinating Iranian Scientist
articles.content:
Iran Says Israel behind Assassinating Iranian Scientist
						
 Tehran, July 30 (KCNA) -- Iranian Foreign Ministry spokesman Ramin Mehmanparast said Tuesday that the Zionist regime of Israel is behind the assassination of an Iranian scientist.
					 Talking to the reporters in his weekly press briefing, Mehmanparast said terrorists supported by Israel resort to assassination of Iranian scholars as the U.S.-led sanctions have failed to prevent Iran from making progress.

articles.title: Hezbollah Chief Accuses Israel against Exploiting Lebanon's Offshore Resources
articles.content:
Hezbollah Chief Accuses Israel against Exploiting Lebanon's Offshore Resources
						
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- The top leader of Lebanese Shiite armed group Hezbollah, Hassan Nasrallah, in a speech at a meeting Tuesday accused Israel against attempts to appropriate Lebanon's offshore gas and oil resources.
					 Whoever harms Lebanon's future (to explore its offshore reserves) will face the same damage, he said.
					
					 He added that his group will emerge victorious in any future war with the Jewish state. His group was better equipped and ready than at any time, he noted.

articles.title: Palestinian Representative Condemns Israel
articles.content:
Palestinian Representative Condemns Israel
						
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- The permanent representative of Palestine to the UN bitterly condemned Israel, speaking at a UN Security Council meeting on the situation in the Middle East on July 26.
					 He said that Israel is stopping the peace process with a refusal to acknowledge pre-June 1967 borders.
					
					 He strongly demanded the Israeli authorities stop at once the construction of the settlements of Zionists in Palestinian land and lift the blockade on the Gaza Strip at an early date.

articles.title: Sudan Criticizes US Real Intention
articles.content:
Sudan Criticizes US Real Intention
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Sudanese Ministry of Foreign Affairs in an interview with a news agency on Wednesday disclosed the U.S. sinister intention.
					 The U.S. ambassador to the UN Security Council said that human rights are being violated in South Kordofan of Sudan, expressing concern over this. This is aimed at fostering hostile acts against the Sudanese government and intrude armed forces into this region, the spokesman noted.

articles.title: More US Military Deaths in Afghanistan
articles.content:
More US Military Deaths in Afghanistan
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- More U.S. troops in Afghanistan involved in the "war on terrorism" met deaths due to the attack operations of the resistance forces of the country.
					 At least 1,568 members of the U.S. military had died in Afghanistan since the start of the Afghan war, the U.S. Defense Department said on July 26.

articles.title: Profit Fall in Japan's Enterprises
articles.content:
Profit Fall in Japan's Enterprises
						
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- Nippon Steel Corp. of Japan said Wednesday its group operating profit in the April-June period fell 24.5 percent from a year before.
					 JFE Holdings Inc. of Japan, too, said its group net profit for the April-June quarter dropped 74.5 percent from a year earlier.

articles.title: Economic Depression in US
articles.content:
Economic Depression in US
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- Sales of new single-family houses in the United States declined by 1 percent in June, fresh evidence of the still faltering market, the U.S. Commerce Department reported on Tuesday.
					 The U.S. Chrysler Group LLC reported Tuesday a net loss of 370 million dollars for the second quarter.

articles.title: Natural Damage in China
articles.content:
Natural Damage in China
						
 Beijing, July 30 (KCNA) -- Heavy rains and hails hit Huabei and northeastern and other areas of China from July 22.
					 According to the office of the National Disaster Reduction Committee, the flood and landslides caused by heavy rains and hails left 54 people dead and another three were missing in 18 provinces and autonomous regions as of July 27.
					
					 The number of total victims is more than 6,399,000 and the amount of economic losses is 4,070 million RMB. Y. 
					
					 Big damage was done in Shandong, Sichuan and Hubei provinces and Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region. 
					
					 Relief steps are being taken in the afflicted areas.

articles.title: Earthquake Hits China, Mexico
articles.content:
Earthquake Hits China, Mexico
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- A 5.2-magnitude earthquake hit Qinghe County in Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region, China on July 25.
					 The epicenter was about 10 km underground in the county.
					
					 More than 460 people were evacuated and many dwelling houses destroyed. A total of the victims is at least 23,000. Steps are being taken on the spot to eradicate the aftermath of the earthquake.
					
					 A 5.9-magnitude earthquake hit Mexico on Tuesday.
					
					 The epicenter was located in the northern state of Sinaloa, some 100 kilometers southeast of the sugar-growing town of Los Mochis.
